messages.content: You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Living Room Thermostat
  ***Properties***
    Current Temperature
      Range 5.0 to 35.0 Unit °C
    Target Temperature
      Range 10.0 to 30.0 Unit °C
    Mode
      Enum
        Off [0]
        Heat [1]
        Cool [2]
        Auto [3]
    Fan Speed
      Enum
        Low [0]
        Medium [1]
        High [2]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Target Temperature [STT]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 10.0 to 30.0 Unit °C
    Set Mode [SM]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          Off [0]
          Heat [1]
          Cool [2]
          Auto [3]
    Set Fan Speed [SFS]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          Low [0]
          Medium [1]
          High [2]
    Query Status [QS]

USER QUERY:
Can you set the thermostat to cool mode and target temperature to 22 degrees Celsius?

First, I review the device structure: the thermostat supports modes Off, Heat, Cool, and Auto, with corresponding enum values. The accepted commands include Set Mode (SM) and Set Target Temperature (STT). The target temperature range is 10.0 to 30.0 °C, and 22 °C is within this range.

To fulfill the request, I will issue the Set Mode command with parameter 'Cool' (enum value 2) and the Set Target Temperature command with parameter 22.0 °C.

Result: Execute SM with parameter 2 to set mode to Cool, then STT with parameter 22.0 to set the target temperature to 22 °C.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Master Bedroom Ceiling Fan
  ***Properties***
    Power Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Speed Level
      Range 0 to 5 Unit Level
        Off [0]
    Oscillation
      Enum
        Disabled [0]
        Enabled [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Turn On [ON]
    Turn Off [OFF]
    Set Speed [SS]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 5 Unit Level
    Enable Oscillation [EO]
    Disable Oscillation [DO]
    Query Status [QS]

USER QUERY:
Please turn on the fan, set speed to 3, and enable oscillation.

I analyze the device structure: the fan has properties Power Status (On/Off), Speed Level (0-5), and Oscillation (Enabled/Disabled). Commands include Turn On, Turn Off, Set Speed with a parameter 0-5, Enable Oscillation, and Disable Oscillation.

To meet the user's request, I will first send the Turn On command to power the fan on. Then, I will send Set Speed with parameter 3 to set the speed level. Finally, I will send Enable Oscillation to activate oscillation.

Result: Execute ON to turn on the fan, SS with parameter 3 to set speed to 3, and EO to enable oscillation.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Outdoor Garden Sprinkler
  ***Properties***
    Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Water Flow Rate
      Range 0.0 to 15.0 Unit L/min
    Schedule Enabled
      Enum
        False [0]
        True [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Turn On [ON]
    Turn Off [OFF]
    Set Flow Rate [SFR]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0.0 to 15.0 Unit L/min
    Enable Schedule [ES]
    Disable Schedule [DS]
    Query Status [QS]

USER QUERY:
Can you start the sprinkler with a flow rate of 10 liters per minute and enable the watering schedule?

Reviewing the device structure, the sprinkler has Status (On/Off), Water Flow Rate (0.0 to 15.0 L/min), and Schedule Enabled (True/False). Commands include Turn On, Turn Off, Set Flow Rate with a parameter in L/min, Enable Schedule, and Disable Schedule.

The user wants to start the sprinkler with a flow rate of 10 L/min and enable the schedule. First, I will send Set Flow Rate with parameter 10.0 L/min, then Turn On to start watering, and finally Enable Schedule to activate the schedule.

Result: Execute SFR with parameter 10.0 to set flow rate, ON to start the sprinkler, and ES to enable the watering schedule.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Garage Door Controller
  ***Properties***
    Door Position
      Range 0 to 100 Unit %
        Closed [0]
        Open [100]
    Lock Status
      Enum
        Locked [0]
        Unlocked [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Open Door [OD]
    Close Door [CD]
    Stop Door [SD]
    Lock Door [LD]
    Unlock Door [UD]
    Query Status [QS]

USER QUERY:
Is the garage door fully closed and locked right now?

The device properties include Door Position (0-100%) where 0% means closed and 100% means open, and Lock Status which can be Locked or Unlocked.

To answer the user's question, I need to check if Door Position equals 0 (fully closed) and Lock Status equals Locked (enum 0).

If both conditions are true, the door is fully closed and locked; otherwise, it is not.

Result: Verify Door Position is 0% and Lock Status is Locked to confirm the garage door is fully closed and locked.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

***Device***

    Fast On [DFON]

    Dim [DIM]

    Fade Down [FDDOWN]

    Backlight [BL]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Range 0 to 127 Unit Index
    Write Changes [WDU]

USER QUERY:
Set the kitchen nook ceiling light to 75% brightness with a ramp rate of 1.0 minute.

The device properties include Status and On Level both ranging from 0 to 100%, with 0 meaning off. Ramp Rate is an enum with various time values; 1.0 minute corresponds to enum value 12.

The accepted commands include On (DON) with a parameter 0-100%, and Ramp Rate (RR) with an enum parameter.

To set the light to 75% brightness with a ramp rate of 1.0 minute, I first send the RR command with parameter 12 to set the ramp rate, then send the DON command with parameter 75 to turn on the light at 75% brightness.

Result: Execute RR with parameter 12 to set ramp rate to 1.0 minute, then DON with parameter 75 to set brightness to 75%.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

USER QUERY:
Can you quickly turn off the kitchen nook ceiling light and set the backlight to 100?

The device supports Fast Off (DFOF) command to quickly turn off the light, and Backlight (BL) command with a parameter range 0 to 127.

To fulfill the user's request, I will first send the Fast Off command to turn off the light immediately, then set the backlight to 100 using the Backlight command.

Result: Execute DFOF to quickly turn off the light, then BL with parameter 100 to set the backlight level to 100.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

USER QUERY:
I want to brighten the kitchen nook ceiling light and then stop any fading effect.

The device accepts Brighten (BRT) and Fade Stop (FDSTOP) commands. Brighten will increase brightness, and Fade Stop will halt any ongoing fade transitions.

To fulfill the user's request, I will first send the Brighten command to increase brightness, then send Fade Stop to stop any fading effect.

Result: Execute BRT to brighten the light, followed by FDSTOP to stop fading.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

USER QUERY:
What command should I use to dim the kitchen nook ceiling light gradually?

The device supports a Dim (DIM) command to reduce brightness, and also Fade Down (FDDOWN) to gradually decrease brightness over time.

Since the user wants to dim the light gradually, the Fade Down command is appropriate as it performs a smooth dimming effect.

Result: Use the Fade Down (FDDOWN) command to dim the kitchen nook ceiling light gradually.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Living Room Thermostat
  ***Properties***
    Current Temperature
      Range 5.0 to 35.0 Unit °C
    Target Temperature
      Range 10.0 to 30.0 Unit °C
    Mode
      Enum
        Off [0]
        Heat [1]
        Cool [2]
        Auto [3]
    Fan Speed
      Enum
        Low [0]
        Medium [1]
        High [2]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Target Temperature [STT]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 10.0 to 30.0 Unit °C
    Set Mode [SM]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          Off [0]
          Heat [1]
          Cool [2]
          Auto [3]
    Set Fan Speed [SFS]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          Low [0]
          Medium [1]
          High [2]
    Query Status [QS]

USER QUERY:
What is the current temperature and fan speed of the living room thermostat?

The device properties include Current Temperature (5.0 to 35.0 °C) and Fan Speed (Low, Medium, High).

To answer the user's question, I need to query the device status to retrieve the current temperature and fan speed values.

Result: Use the Query Status (QS) command to obtain the current temperature and fan speed of the living room thermostat.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Master Bedroom Ceiling Fan
  ***Properties***
    Power Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Speed Level
      Range 0 to 5 Unit Level
        Off [0]
    Oscillation
      Enum
        Disabled [0]
        Enabled [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Turn On [ON]
    Turn Off [OFF]
    Set Speed [SS]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 5 Unit Level
    Enable Oscillation [EO]
    Disable Oscillation [DO]
    Query Status [QS]

USER QUERY:
Please disable oscillation and set the fan speed to low.

The device properties include Oscillation (Enabled/Disabled) and Speed Level (0 to 5). The accepted commands include Disable Oscillation (DO) and Set Speed (SS) with a parameter 0 to 5.

The user wants to disable oscillation and set fan speed to low. According to the enum, low speed corresponds to 0 or 1? The Speed Level range is 0 to 5 with Off at 0, so low speed is likely 1.

Therefore, I will send the Disable Oscillation command and Set Speed with parameter 1.

Result: Execute DO to disable oscillation and SS with parameter 1 to set fan speed to low.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Outdoor Garden Sprinkler
  ***Properties***
    Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Water Flow Rate
      Range 0.0 to 15.0 Unit L/min
    Schedule Enabled
      Enum
        False [0]
        True [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Turn On [ON]
    Turn Off [OFF]
    Set Flow Rate [SFR]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0.0 to 15.0 Unit L/min
    Enable Schedule [ES]
    Disable Schedule [DS]
    Query Status [QS]

USER QUERY:
How do I disable the watering schedule and turn off the sprinkler?

The device properties include Schedule Enabled (True/False) and Status (On/Off). The accepted commands include Disable Schedule (DS) and Turn Off (OFF).

To disable the watering schedule and turn off the sprinkler, I will send the DS command to disable the schedule, then the OFF command to turn off the sprinkler.

Result: Execute DS to disable the watering schedule, followed by OFF to turn off the sprinkler.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Garage Door Controller
  ***Properties***

        Closed [0]
        Open [100]
    Lock Status

        Locked [0]
        Unlocked [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Open Door [OD]
    Close Door [CD]
    Stop Door [SD]
    Lock Door [LD]
    Unlock Door [UD]
    Query Status [QS]

USER QUERY:
Please open the garage door and unlock it.

The device properties include Door Position (0-100%) and Lock Status (Locked/Unlocked). The accepted commands include Open Door (OD), Close Door (CD), Lock Door (LD), Unlock Door (UD).

To open the garage door and unlock it, I will send the Unlock Door command first to ensure it can open, then send the Open Door command.

Result: Execute UD to unlock the door, followed by OD to open the garage door.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Living Room Thermostat
  ***Properties***
    Current Temperature

        Range 10.0 to 30.0 Unit °C
    Set Mode [SM]

        Enum
          Off [0]
          Heat [1]
          Cool [2]
          Auto [3]
    Set Fan Speed [SFS]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          Low [0]
          Medium [1]
          High [2]
    Query Status [QS]

USER QUERY:
I want to set the fan speed to high and turn off the thermostat.

The device supports setting fan speed with Set Fan Speed (SFS) command and turning off the thermostat by setting Mode to Off using Set Mode (SM).

Fan Speed enum values are Low=0, Medium=1, High=2. Mode enum values include Off=0.

To fulfill the request, I will send SFS with parameter 2 to set fan speed to high, then SM with parameter 0 to turn off the thermostat.

Result: Execute SFS with parameter 2 to set fan speed to high, then SM with parameter 0 to turn off the thermostat.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Master Bedroom Ceiling Fan
  ***Properties***
    Power Status

    Speed Level

    Turn Off [OFF]
    Set Speed [SS]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 5 Unit Level
    Enable Oscillation [EO]
    Disable Oscillation [DO]
    Query Status [QS]

USER QUERY:
Is the fan currently on and oscillating?

The device properties include Power Status (On/Off) and Oscillation (Enabled/Disabled).

To answer if the fan is currently on and oscillating, I need to query the device status to check if Power Status equals On (1) and Oscillation equals Enabled (1).

Result: Use Query Status (QS) command to retrieve current Power Status and Oscillation state to determine if the fan is on and oscillating.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

USER QUERY:
What is the current water flow rate and is the schedule enabled for the garden sprinkler?

The device properties include Water Flow Rate (0.0 to 15.0 L/min) and Schedule Enabled (True/False).

To answer the user's question, I need to query the device status to retrieve the current water flow rate and schedule enabled state.

Result: Use Query Status (QS) command to obtain the current water flow rate and whether the schedule is enabled for the garden sprinkler.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***

  ***Properties***

    Close Door [CD]
    Stop Door [SD]
    Lock Door [LD]
    Unlock Door [UD]
    Query Status [QS]

USER QUERY:
Stop the garage door immediately if it is moving.

The device supports a Stop Door (SD) command to halt door movement immediately.

To stop the garage door if it is moving, I will send the Stop Door command.

Result: Execute SD command to stop the garage door immediately.
